Text saved: A gene is a small part of your body. It tells your body how to grow and work. We have more questions about genes. We want to know how they affect our brain and language. Did some genes change and give us the power to speak? Scientists found a change in a gene. This change happened a long time ago. It happened between 100,000 and 200,000 years ago. This gene seems important for speaking. It helps our brain move our mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar gene. But their gene did not change. We do not know now how important genes are for language. But one day we might find the answers in our DNA.
